intro: Impatiens fenghwaiana, commonly known as the Fenghwa Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains a relatively rare and less-studied species.
